nl: Let $\mathcal{T}_\alpha$ be a family of topologies on $X$. Show that there is a unique smallest topology on $X$ containing all the collections $\mathcal{T}_\alpha$.
lean:
∀ (X I : Type*) (T : I → Set (Set X)) (h : ∀ i, is_topology X (T i)), ∃! T', is_topology X T' ∧ (∀ i, T i ⊆ T') ∧
  ∀ T'', is_topology X T'' → (∀ i, T i ⊆ T'') → T' ⊆ T''
candidate: ∀ {X : Type*} {I : Sort*} {T : I → TopologicalSpace X} : ∃ (t, TopologicalSpace X), ∀ i, t ≤ T i ∧ ∀ s, (∀ i, s ≤ T i) → s ≤ t
imports:
import Mathlib

open Filter Set TopologicalSpace
open scoped Topology



def is_topology (X : Type*) (T : Set (Set X)) :=
  univ ∈ T ∧
  (∀ s t, s ∈ T → t ∈ T → s ∩ t ∈ T) ∧
  (∀s, (∀t ∈ s, t ∈ T) → sUnion s ∈ T)
